Standards#

Here, standard functions thorughout the library are defined. These are typically functions which are used regularly.

C++ Classes#

class string#

Class string which adds additional functions to std::string

Public Functions

std::size_t find_back(mml::string name, std::size_t pos = 0, std::size_t low = 0)#

Note

Check if a string exists but starting from the right side

Parameters:

  • name – String to look for

  • std::size_t, optional – Value from where to search for the string. 0 means that it is not used.

  • std::size_t, optional – Lower limit to which point is searched for.

Returns:

std::size_t

uint32_t hash()#

Creates a hash value of this instance. This hash value can then be used for example in an switch … case with strings by using hash values.

Returns:

uint32_t

std::vector<std::string> ls(std::string name_include, std::string name_exclude, std::vector<std::string> &directories, bool recursive = false, bool all = false)#

List all files and directories in a path. Directories end with ‘/’ in the entry

Author

Mike

Note

If name_include or name_exclude is detected for a directory, all the elements in this directory are either included or excluded, respectively.

Parameters:

  • std::string – Only list files or directories which include this string in the name.

  • std::string – Exclude files or directories with this string in the name

  • std::vector<std::string> – Reference to a vector where the directories are added

  • bool – Check directory recursively

  • bool – Also list hidden files

Returns:

std::vector<std::string>

std::vector<std::string> ls(std::string name_include = "", std::string name_exclude = "", bool recursive = false, bool all = false)#

List all files and directories in a path. Directories end with ‘/’ in the entry

Author

Mike

Note

If name_include or name_exclude is detected for a directory, all the elements in this directory are either included or excluded, respectively.

Parameters:

  • std::string – Only list files or directories which include this string in the name.

  • std::string – Exclude files or directories with this string in the name

  • bool – Check directory recursively

  • bool – Also list hidden files

Returns:

std::vector<std::string>

std::string mml::date(mml::string value, std::string separator1 = ":", std::string separator2 = ".")#

Returns the actual date and/or time as a std::string

Author

Mike

Parameters:

  • mml::string – Determines what information is printed.

    • ”Date” : DD.MM.YYYY (based on separator1)

    • ”Time” : HH:MM:SS (based on separator1)

    • ”Date+Time” : Complete date in format DD.MM.YYYY HH:MM:SS.

    • ”Date1+Time” : Compete date in format YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS.

  • std::string, optional – First separation sign for the date

  • std::string, optional – Second separation sign for the time

Returns:

std::string

uint32_t mml::date(int info, time_t time1 = -1)#

Returns the wished info from the time (like date etc.) Options are:

  • 0: Seconds

  • 1: Minutes

  • 2: Hours

  • 3: Day

  • 4: Month

  • 5: Year

  • 6: Summertime

  • 7: Weekday (Days since sunday)

  • 8: Yearday (Days since New Year)

  • 9: kw

Author

Mike

Parameters:

  • int – Determines what information is printed

  • time_t – Time for which the information is printed. -1 => Actual time now.

Returns:

unsigned integer
